cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 450 miles southwest of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-northeast, forecast to cross Florida’s Big Bend Monday evening then sweep northeast just offshore of GA/SC and the southern NC coast before racing into the open Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Apalachicola/Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Altamaha Sound GA to South Santee River SC (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Altamaha Sound GA to Sebastian Inlet FL on the Atlantic side; Indian Pass to Englewood FL on the Gulf side (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, Florida Atlantic Coast, Georgia, South Carolina, and southern North Carolina shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Tuesday; sustained winds mainly 20–30 mph.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation below 3 ft possible, especially at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated totals up to 8 inches; localized flooding expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough surf, dangerous rip currents, and a low risk of an isolated tornado in coastal NC.
